name: mipciot
0:
”Alexa: turn on bedroom”
”Alexa: turn off bedroom”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
To use your Amazon Echo with your MIPC socket, make sure you have the latest Alexa app on your device, and activate the mipc.iot Skill. This will require your mipc account and password to authorize Alexa to access your lights.

To get started, select the "Enable Skill" button in the Alexa App to link your mipc account and discover your devices.
When using the skill, you need to specify by name which device to use. You can set the devices' name in mipc app which controls your devices. you can find the exact mipc app name in your product user manuel.

Your mipc socket now talk directly to the Amazon Echo through the Alexa Connected Home Integration. You can control your wifi socket with simple statements like:

Alexa, Turn on the socket

Alexa, Turn off the baby. (In order for users to be able to say “Alexa, turn on the baby” the device needs to be named “baby”.)

Alexa, Turn on the bedroom(In order for users to be able to say “Alexa, turn on the bedroom” the device needs to be named “bedroom”.)
